result.execSummary:
The defendant Lacey May Chier was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misdemeanor Theft, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: RESTITUTION - to be determined.  Court orders a restitution hearing to be held in approx 60 days.  On January 12, 2016 Court orders restitution in the amount of $31,189.21.
Defendant is to re-pay the costs for court appointed counsel - to be determined.  On January 18, 2016 Court orders re-payment of court appointed attorney fees in the amount of $3,437.00.

- AODA and any follow-up
- Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
- All prescriptions are to be used as prescribed according to the prescription.
- Defendant is to notify her agent within 24 hours of any prescription.
- Defendant is subject to random drug & alcohol screenings

11:26 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Daniel Kaminsky.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin. 

Thomas R. Chier sworn, direct by by DA Christenson.  Testimony given.  State's Exhibit #1 - Bank Statement from Markesan State Bank.  State offers exhibit #1.  No objections.  Court receives exhibit #1.  Statement by Atty Kaminsky, stips to items in orange, that they are for defendant's accounts.  Court so notes.  Cross exam by Atty Kaminsky.  Court questions witness.

Lacey Chier sworn, direct by Atty Daniel Kaminsky.  Testimony given.  Cross exam by DA Christenson.  Court questions witness.  Re-cross by DA Christenson.

Statement by Atty Kaminsky - requests a couple of minutes to speak with defendant's father.

Argument by DA Christenson - requests $31,189.21 be ordered as restitution.  Argument by Atty Kaminsky.

Court orders restitution in the amount of $31,189.21 and is to be paid as a condition of probation.

Court adjourned at 12:15 p.m.
Restitution hearing at 01-12-2016 11:00 am

11:22 a.m.  (All cases) Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Dan Kaminsky.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Kaminsky - has received a plea offer and defendant has accepted the offer and recites agreement - in 2014CF73 will enter Alford Plea to count 2, balance of the counts will be dismissed and read-in; on 2015CF45 defendant will plea to count 1 & 2 and count 3 amended to DC, with the balance of the counts being dismissed and read-in; and on 2014CF124 - defendant will plea NC to count 2 and count 1 will be dismissed and read-in.  State concurs.  Defendant concurs.  DA confirms compliance with victim rights.  Court grants the amendment of count 3 on 2015CF45.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions.

Defendant enters an ALFORD plea and NO CONTEST plea.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 2 on 2014CF73; counts 1,2 & 3 on 2015CF45 and count 2 on 2014CF124.  Court orders the balance of the counts be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Kaminsky.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

2014CF73 / 2015CF45 / 2014CF124

SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 3 years, concurrent to each other.

CONDITIONS:
-AODA and any follow-up
-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
-All prescriptions are to be used as prescribed according to the prescription.
-Defendant is to notify her agent within 24 hours of any prescription.
-Defendant is subject to random drug & alcohol screenings
-Court costs
-Defendant is to repay the costs for court appointed counsel
-2015CF45 - Restitution of $1,267.55

Restitution in 2014CF73 is to be determined and orders a restitution hearing be scheduled with the next 60 days.

Court grants the defendant sentence credit as determined by the jail.

Court adjourned at 11:49 a.m.

10:11 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Max Saylor.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  State has received a copy of the competency report.  Atty Saylor has received a copy of the competency report.  Court goes over report.  Atty has had discussion with the defendant, makes statement - defendant is incompetent.  Court questions defendant.  Statement by defendant - incompetent.  Court suspends the proceedings.  Defendant is committed to the dept of health and social services for a period not to exceed 12 months.  ADA requests the defendant be transported to Winnebago Mental Health.  Statement by Atty Saylor - would like to continue with outpatient treatment.  Statement by ADA.  Statement by the Court.  Court orders the department to submit a status report for defendant at 3 months, 6 months and 9 months.  Court orders report and criminal complaint to the Department.  Court remands the defendant to be turned over to the Department of Health and social services.

9:47 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs defendant of his/her right to an attorney.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $1,000.00 signature bond and conditions of:  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.  Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives the time limits.
